sentences.sContent: Matt’s behavior was arousing the interest of the neighbors.
sentences.sCn: 马特的行为渐渐引起了邻居的兴趣。

sentences.sContent: Anne had to be aroused from a deep sleep.
sentences.sCn: 不得不把安妮从沉睡中唤醒。

sentences.sContent: ...Internet providers arouse customers’ anger over bandwidth speed and cost...
...Apple is just one of many technology firms trying to arouse his uncontrollable spirit in new products...

remMethod.val: a ＋ rouse(唤醒， 激起) → 引起； 唤起， 唤醒

trans.tranOther: to make you become interested, expect something etc; to wake someone
